Candidat e:   Hazeeq Muhaim ien Mohammad Azlan   
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS

QUALIFICATIONS  
 
BSc. Chemical Engineerin g, concentration in Bioenergy  – Michig an State University  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2017 to present ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  
 
2019 t o present  
Position: Team Lead, Process Monitoring and Analysis (Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) /Alky 
Team)  
• Coached and planned global project rollouts for 20 engineers. Collaborated with senior 
management to evaluate and improve KPI targets and key deliverables.

Candidat e:   Hazeeq Muhaim ien Mohammad Azlan   
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Malaysia   
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
BSc. Chemical Engineerin g, concentration in Bioenergy  – Michig an State University  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2017 to present ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  
 
2019 t o present  
Position: Team Lead, Process Monitoring and Analysis (Fluid Catalytic Cracking (FCC) /Alky 
Team)  
• Coached and planned global project rollouts for 20 engineers. Collaborated with senior 
management to evaluate and improve KPI targets and key deliverables.  
• Investigated 7 HSE issues, identified corrective and preventative measures to ensure safe work 
environment as Safety Lead. Developed 5 SOPs and work assessment guidelines to prevent 
losses and ensure team’s success.  
• Analyzed the feasibility of processing new crude and led the management of change (MOC) to 
revise the feed properties operating envelo pe which increased the refinery revenue by $10 mil 
per year.  
• Participated in a HAZOP study for a refinery in Australia. Examined 200+ potential scenarios to 
identify risks and proposed steps to mitigate potential issues and hazards by utilizing 
PROII/HYS YS and P&ID.  
• Developed a catalyst utilization tool for FCC to optimize catalyst additions and catalyst additives 
such as DeSOx, ZSM -5 and CO -Promoter to save OPEX of $2 million per year. Worked with 
multinational catalyst vendor companies to conduct cata lyst selection studies for EM refineries.  
 
2017 –2019  
Position:  Process Monitoring and Analysis Engineer (Chemical Engineer)  
• Optimized and benchmarked unit process operations and performance for FCC, Alkylation, 
Fractionation, Furnace and Coker technologies, to ensure safe and reliable operation, and 
maximize profitability.  
• Provided technical consultancy for 8 ExxonMobil's downstream refineries in the US, Canada, 
Europe, UAE and Australia. Advised clients on oper ating strategy, achieved reliability and 
margin capture of $10 Mil/year.  
 • Involved in a $5 million worth FCC Riser project which doubled the unit’s run -length, prevented 
unplanned shutdown and improved reliability. Provided support for refinery FCC Turnar ound 
and project commissioning.  
• Utilized JMP, SeeQ Advance Analytics and Excel VBA to analyze process data and build 
prediction models (multivariate fit, linear and non -linear regression analysis), which led to 
cumulative benefit of $15 mil.  
• Solved a l ong-standing FCC mass and energy balance (HMB) closure issue by utilizing PIMS 
tool to represent the feed and products properties.  
 
October 2016 – March 2017 Michigan Biotech Institute, East Lansing, Michigan  
Position: Research Assistant   
• Developed  ammonia pretreatment process for lignocellulosic biomass to yield 50% more 
biofuels  
• Operated chemical reactors and distillation columns to convert biomass into biofuels. Analyzed 
40 successful test results.  
 
2016  Petronas Chemicals  Group Berhad, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  
Position: Chemical Engineering Intern  
• Analyzed and improved the integrated process of producing acetic acid, ammonia, and 
petrochemical products.  
• Developed an economic and value chain model to increase the net profit of carbon  monoxide 
and acetic acid production. Presented to senior management and received recognition for Best 
Intern  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Passionate, self -driven Chemical Engineer, eager to learn about Energy, Oil & Gas, Data Analytics, 
Consultan cy, Leadership and Management. 4 years of experience in the oil & gas and energy industry 
as a process engineer and data analyst.  
 
Awards  
• Ranked top 5 in ExxonMobil ranking cycle (pool of 100 employees) for 3 consecutive years  
• 7 ExxonMobil Leadership Awards (20 awards per year)  
• 5 ExxonMobil Technical Excellence Awards (50 awards per year)  
• MSU Dean’s List Award for 8 consecutive semesters  
• MSU College of Engineering Sara V Larian Memorial Scholarship in 2017 (5 awards per year 
for 1,000 applicants)  
• MSU Emerging Student Leader Award in 2016 (5 awards per year for most outstanding student 
organization President)  
 
Skills   
• PRO II/ HYSIS  
• MATLAB  
• Microsoft Office (

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
